data.title: Placements : Department of Resource Economics : UMass Amherst
data.meta_description: Learn more about where graduates of the program in resource economics have found opportunities after graduation.
data.text:
We take pride in the placement of our graduate students. The Master's program prepares our students for careers in marketing, resource-based industries such as electric utilities and petroleum, government environmental policy positions, and economic consulting. Doctoral program graduates find employment in research positions in industry, academia, and government. Please see below for the current positions of our recent MS and PhD graduates.

Note: International students in our MS and PhD programs are able to apply for a STEM Optional Practical Training work permit, which allows them to work in the United States for up to 36 months after graduation. See here for details.
